attributes.action: Emily Davison - erect a statue in Parliament
attributes.additional_details:
100 years ago, Emily Wilding Davison died having been trampled by the King's Horse. She was a leading member of the suffragette movement and a fighter for women's rights.

Of the 100 non-royal statues in the Palace of Westminster only 6 are of women.

I call upon the Parliamentary authorities to erect a statue in her memory.
